name: Computing Research Group
body:
We are a group of individuals from the Department of Computing and Applied Physics at GMIT who are interested in various topics related to computing and the Internet of Things.

#### People

## Ian McLoughlin
[ian.mcloughlin@gmit.ie]()

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/gmit-computing/gmit-computing.github.io/master/images/ian.jpg)

[![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/gmit-computing/gmit-computing.github.io/master/images/github.png)](http://www.github.com/ianmcloughlin)
[![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/gmit-computing/gmit-computing.github.io/master/images/linkedin.png)](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mcloughlinian)

Dr. Ian McLoughlin is a lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Applied Physics at the Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology (GMIT) in Ireland, where he teaches modules in Algorithms, Mobile Application Development, Graphics Programming, and Graph Theory, among others.

Previously he held academic positions at the Institute of Technology, Sligo, the Digital Enterprise Research Institute (now The Insight Centre for Data Analytics) at the National University of Ireland, Galway, and the Clique Research Cluster (now also Insight) at University College Dublin.

Ian has worked in industry at the Aon Centre for Innovation and Analytics in Dublin and at IBM Research in Zurich, Switzerland.
He was involved in the development of in-house web applications at IBM Research, Aon, UCD, NUIG and Stanford.
In his current role, Ian has collaborated with industry partners in a number of areas, such as Image Recognition, Cloud Computing, and Mobile Computing.

Ian holds a Ph.D. in Mathematics from the National University of Ireland, Galway for which he was awarded an IRCSET scholarship. In 2014 he was the recipient of a Fulbright TechImpact Award which he took up as a Visiting Scholar at Stanford University in California.

*Interests:* Combinatorics, Data Analytics, Mobile Applications, Cloud Computing, Computer Vision, Mathematics.
